SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class Alignments

java.lang.Object
  opennlp.ccg.alignment.Alignments

public final class Alignments
extends Object

Static non-instantiable class that provides convenience methods for reading and writing phrases, mappings, and alignments.

The convenience methods tokenize split a string into an array of strings, and the untokenize methods provide their inverses.

The readXxxPhrases() methods all call readPhrases(PhraseReader) to read phrases from an underlying reader. Depending on the method, phrases are assumed to be identified or to merely occur in sequence. Similarly, the writeXxxPhrases all call writePhrases(List, PhraseWriter).

Mappings can be read using readMappings(...) methods, which will read mappings as formatted by the specified format. The readSortedMappings(...) methods are variants of these that return a map with sorted keys that map to sorted sets of mappings. The methods writeMappings(Map, File, MappingFormat) and writeMappings(Map, Writer, MappingFormat) perform the inverse of the methods for reading.

Finally, the readXxxAlignments() methods combine the methods for reading phrases and mappings to allow alignments to be read. The methods writeAlignments(List, File, File, File, String, MappingFormat) and writeAlignments(List, Writer, Writer, Writer, String, MappingFormat) write alignments according to a specified word separator and mapping format.

Author:
Scott Martin
See Also:
PhraseReader, PhraseWriter, IdentifiedPhraseReader, IdentifiedPhraseWriter, MappingReader, MappingWriter, MappingFormat

                                          throws IOException
Reads phrases from the specified reader. The input is assumed to have markup accompanying the phrase data that indicates the phrase ID for each phrase.

Parameters:
r - The underlying reader.
phraseNumberBase - The index base to translate line numbers into.
phraseTag - The tag name for markup signaling a phrase.
phraseIdentifierAttribute - The name of the attribute that contains the phrase's ID in the markup.

readPhrases

public static List<Phrase> readPhrases(PhraseReader reader)
                                throws IOException
Reads phrases sequentially from the specified phrase reader.

Returns:
A list of phrases in the order they are encountered by calling PhraseReader.readPhrase() on the specified reader.
Throws:
IOException - if one is thrown by the specified phrase reader.

wordSeparator - The string to use to untokenize with.

padding - Whether or not to include padding between the markup and the phrase data.

readMappings

                                                     MappingFormat format)
                                              throws IOException

Throws:
IOException
See Also:
readMappings(MappingReader)

readMappings

public static Map<Integer,Set<Mapping>> readMappings(MappingReader reader)
                                              throws IOException
Reads mappings from the specified mapping reader. Once all available mappings have been read, the specified reader is closed.

Parameters:
reader - The mapping reader to read mappings from.
Returns:
A map whose keys are the phrase numbers of the corresponding phrases and whose values are sets containing the mappings for the key phrase. Both the keys and the sets of mappings are maintained in the order in which they occur in the input.
Throws:
IOException - if the underlying reader throws an exception, or if one of the mapping groups contains a duplicate mapping.
See Also:
MappingReader

writeMappings

public static void writeMappings(Map<Integer,Set<Mapping>> map,
                                 MappingWriter writer)
                          throws IOException
Writes the specified map to the specified writer, starting mapping groups as needed based on the key and the size of the value set. After all the sets of mappings in the map have been written, MappingWriter.close() is called.

Parameters:
map - The mappings to write.
writer - The underlying writer to write to.
Throws:
IOException - if one occurs in the underlying writer.
See Also:
MappingGroup

Throws:
IOException
See Also:
readAlignments(PhraseReader, PhraseReader, Reader, MappingFormat)

readAlignments

public static List<Alignment> readAlignments(PhraseReader phraseA,
                                             PhraseReader phraseB,
                                             Reader mappings,
                                             MappingFormat format)
                                      throws IOException
Reads alignments from the specified readers, using the provided format to parse mappings. The line numbers of the phrases are translated into the phrase number base of the format's encoding scheme.

Parameters:
phraseA - The reader from which the A-position phrases are read.
phraseB - The reader from which the B-position phrases are read.
mappings - The reader whose input contains the mappings from A-phrases to B-phrases, where the A-position indices are assumed to correspond to the phrases in phraseA and the B-position indices are assumed to correspond to the phrases in phraseB.
format - The mapping format used to parse mappings read from mapping.
Returns:
A list of alignments where the A-phrases are from phraseA, the B-phrases are from phraseB, and the mappings are the ones read from mappings with the corresponding phrase number.
Throws:
IOException - if phraseA has a different number of phrases than phraseB, or if one is thrown by any of the underlying readers.
See Also:
PhraseReader, MappingReader, readPhrases(PhraseReader), readMappings(MappingReader)

writeAlignments

public static void writeAlignments(List<Alignment> alignments,
                                   File phraseA,
                                   File phraseB,
                                   File mappings,
                                   String wordSeparator,
                                   MappingFormat format)
                            throws IOException
Writes a list of alignments to the specified files, using the word separator and format provided.

Throws:
IOException
See Also:
writeAlignments(List, Writer, Writer, Writer, String, MappingFormat)

writeAlignments

public static void writeAlignments(List<Alignment> alignments,
                                   Writer phraseA,
                                   Writer phraseB,
                                   Writer mappings,
                                   String wordSeparator,
                                   MappingFormat format)
                            throws IOException
Writes a list of alignments to the specified readers, using the word separator and format provided. After all the alignments are written, all the associated writers are closed.

Parameters:
alignments - The alignments to write.
phraseA - The writer to which A-position phrases are written.
phraseB - The writer to which B-position phrases are written.
mappings - The mappings to write, where the A-position indices are assumed to correspond to the phrases in phraseA and the B-position indices are assumed to correspond to the ones in phraseB.
wordSeparator - The word separator to use for untokenization.
format - The format to use for formatting mappings in the alignments.
Throws:
IOException - if one is thrown by any of the underlying writers.
